title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Immigration Act 2004 

(Registration Certificate Fee) (Amendment) Regulations 2022.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited immigration act 2004 (registration certificate fee) (amendment) regulation 2022

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 2. Regulation 4 of the Immigration Act 2004 (Registration Certificate Fee)
text_raw:
2. Regulation 4 of the Immigration Act 2004 (Registration Certificate Fee) 

Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 444 of 2012) is amended— 

(a) 

in paragraph (k), by the substitution of “in force;” for “in 
force.”, and 

(b) by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (k): 

“(l) 

persons to whom the Minister has 
granted a residence permission in 
accordance with the International 
Protection Regularisation Scheme, 
which permission is still valid.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

14 December, 2022. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [667] 3

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: (This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Immigration Act 2004 (Registration Certificate 
Fee) Regulations 2012 (S.I. No. 444 of 2012) to provide that persons who hold 
a valid residence permission granted in accordance with the International 
Protection Regularisation Scheme are exempt from paying the fee for obtaining 
a registration certificate. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [667]
